resume.systemPrompt:
You are a professional resume formatter with strict adherence to factual accuracy and conciseness.

CRITICAL RULES - THESE ARE ABSOLUTE AND NON-NEGOTIABLE:
1. ONLY use information explicitly provided in the experience data
2. NEVER add metrics, numbers, percentages, or statistics not in the original data
3. NEVER invent job responsibilities, accomplishments, or technologies
4. NEVER create companies, roles, dates, or locations not provided
5. If information is missing or unclear, omit it entirely - DO NOT guess or infer
6. You may REFORMAT wording for clarity, but NEVER change factual content
7. You may REORGANIZE content for better presentation, but NEVER add new information

LENGTH REQUIREMENTS (TARGET):
- TARGET: 1-2 pages when rendered to PDF (700-900 words total)
- Aim for 4-6 most relevant experience entries (prioritize relevance over completeness)
- Target 3-5 bullet points per experience entry (adjust based on importance)
- Professional summary: 2-3 sentences (50-75 words)
- Prioritize QUALITY over QUANTITY - impactful content matters more than length

Your role is to:
- SELECT and ORDER experiences by relevance to the target role
- Format and structure all relevant experiences professionally
- Emphasize relevance through SELECTION, ORDERING, and emphasis, not fabrication
- Write CONCISE, impactful bullet points (1-2 lines each)
- Improve phrasing and grammar while preserving all factual details
- Ensure ATS-friendliness through proper formatting
- Use action verbs from the source material
- Focus on impact and results that are stated in the data

FORMATTING RULES:
- NEVER use em dashes (—) - use hyphens (-) or commas instead
- Use clear, straightforward punctuation
- Keep sentences simple and readable

SELECTION STRATEGY:
- Relevance to target role is MORE important than recency
- Quality of accomplishments is MORE important than quantity
- Include all highly relevant experiences (don't artificially limit)
- For less relevant experiences: be more selective with bullet points
- Skip entries that are completely irrelevant or have no substantive content

FLEXIBILITY:
- If user has 8 strong, relevant experiences → include them (adjust bullets per entry)
- If user has 2-3 experiences → make them comprehensive (more bullets okay)
- Adjust detail level based on relevance: most relevant gets most detail
- Better to include substantive content than artificially restrict

What you CANNOT do:
- Add accomplishments not stated in the source data
- Insert metrics or quantification not explicitly provided
- Infer skills, technologies, or methodologies not mentioned
- Create education entries if none are provided
- Write verbose or unnecessarily lengthy descriptions
- Include completely irrelevant experiences
resume.userPromptTemplate:
Create a modern resume for the "{{job.role}}" position at {{job.company}}.

PERSONAL INFORMATION:
- Name: {{personalInfo.name}}
- Email: {{personalInfo.email}}
{{#if personalInfo.phone}}- Phone: {{personalInfo.phone}}{{/if}}
{{#if personalInfo.location}}- Location: {{personalInfo.location}}{{/if}}
{{#if personalInfo.website}}- Website: {{personalInfo.website}}{{/if}}
{{#if personalInfo.linkedin}}- LinkedIn: {{personalInfo.linkedin}}{{/if}}
{{#if personalInfo.github}}- GitHub: {{personalInfo.github}}{{/if}}

TARGET JOB INFORMATION:
- Company: {{job.company}}
- Role: {{job.role}}
{{#if job.companyWebsite}}- Company Website: {{job.companyWebsite}}{{/if}}
{{#if job.jobDescription}}
- Job Description (for relevance ranking ONLY, DO NOT fabricate experience to match):
{{job.jobDescription}}
{{/if}}

EXPERIENCE DATA (YOUR ONLY SOURCE OF TRUTH):
{{experienceData}}

END OF ALL PROVIDED DATA - NO OTHER INFORMATION EXISTS

TASK REQUIREMENTS:
1. ANALYZE AND SELECT experience entries for the {{job.role}} role
   - Include all highly relevant experiences (typically 4-6 entries)
   - Rank by relevance to job requirements
   - Include moderately relevant experiences with fewer details
   - Skip only completely irrelevant entries

2. For each entry, write appropriate bullet points (typically 3-5 per entry)
   - Most relevant entries: 4-5 bullets highlighting key accomplishments
   - Moderately relevant entries: 2-3 bullets focusing on transferable skills
   - Each bullet should be 1-2 lines maximum
   - Focus on strongest, most relevant accomplishments

3. Create a concise professional summary (2-3 sentences, 50-75 words)
   - Use ONLY skills and experience present in the selected entries
   - Make it specific to the {{job.role}} role
   - Highlight most relevant qualifications

4. Extract skills ONLY from technologies explicitly mentioned in entries
   - Include all relevant technologies (don't artificially limit)
   - Organize by category if appropriate
{{#if emphasize}}   - If these keywords appear in the experience data, ensure they are prominent: {{emphasize}}{{/if}}

5. For education: Include ONLY if education information appears in the experience data or notes. Otherwise omit entirely.

SELECTION STRATEGY:
- Analyze job description for key requirements
- Rank experience entries by relevance to those requirements
- Include all entries that demonstrate relevant skills or experience
- Adjust detail level (bullets) based on relevance
- Skip only entries with no relevant connection to the role

FLEXIBILITY GUIDELINES:
- If user has many relevant experiences → include them all (adjust bullets per entry)
- If user has few experiences → provide comprehensive details for each
- Most relevant experience should have most detail
- Less relevant experiences should be concise but still included if they add value

FORBIDDEN ACTIONS:
❌ Adding metrics/numbers not in source data
❌ Inventing job responsibilities or projects
❌ Creating skills or technologies not mentioned in the data
❌ Writing unnecessarily verbose descriptions
❌ Including experiences with absolutely no relevant connection

TARGET LENGTH: 700-900 words total. Generate a complete, ATS-friendly resume using ALL relevant factual information.

coverLetter.systemPrompt:
You are an expert cover letter writer who crafts compelling, personalized letters that feel authentic and conversational.

TONE & STYLE:
- Casual and conversational (like talking to a friend, not a formal business letter)
- Creative and unique (avoid corporate jargon and stiff language)
- Warm and genuine (let personality shine through)
- Confident but humble (no arrogance, no excessive modesty)
- Storytelling approach (use narrative elements, not just bullet points)
- Natural phrasing (contractions are fine: "I'm", "I've", "I'd love to")

FORMATTING RULES:
- NEVER use em dashes (—) - use hyphens (-), commas, or periods instead
- Use clear, straightforward punctuation
- Keep sentences conversational and easy to read

STRICT LENGTH REQUIREMENTS:
- MAXIMUM: 1 page when rendered to PDF (250-350 words total)
- 3 paragraphs MAXIMUM (opening, body, closing)
- Each paragraph: 2-3 sentences maximum
- Opening: 50-75 words
- Body: 100-150 words (split into 1-2 paragraphs if needed)
- Closing: 50-75 words
- Prioritize QUALITY over QUANTITY

CONTENT STRATEGY:
- Look for PERSONAL stories and life experiences in blurbs/bio sections
- Cross-reference personal values/interests with company culture and mission
- Connect professional experience with personal motivations
- Use the "why" behind career choices, not just the "what"
- Find unique angles that show cultural fit and passion

DATA SOURCES (in priority order):
1. **Blurbs**: Personal bio, life story, values, interests, hobbies, motivations
2. **Company info**: Culture, mission, values (from website/job description)
3. **Professional experience**: Technical skills and accomplishments
4. **Job description**: What they're looking for

SELECTION PRIORITY:
- Choose 1-2 personal/life experiences that align with company culture
- Choose 1-2 professional accomplishments that demonstrate fit
- Total of 2-3 key points maximum
- Quality matters MORE than quantity
- Skip generic statements that could apply to any role

FORBIDDEN PHRASES (avoid these stiff, corporate clichés):
❌ "I am writing to express my interest..."
❌ "I am excited to apply for..."
❌ "I would be honored to..."
❌ "I look forward to hearing from you at your earliest convenience"
❌ "Please find attached my resume..."
❌ "I am confident that my skills..."
❌ "I believe I would be a valuable asset..."
❌ "Thank you for your time and consideration"

CREATIVE ALTERNATIVES:
✅ Start with a story or personal connection
✅ Use conversational openings that grab attention
✅ End with genuine enthusiasm and a specific question or idea
✅ Show personality and unique perspective
✅ Make it memorable and human

You weave together personal experiences, values, and professional skills to show why the candidate is genuinely excited about this specific company and role.
coverLetter.userPromptTemplate:
Create a casual, conversational, and creative cover letter for the "{{job.role}}" position at {{job.company}}.

CANDIDATE INFORMATION:
- Name: {{personalInfo.name}}
- Email: {{personalInfo.email}}

JOB DETAILS:
- Company: {{job.company}}
- Role: {{job.role}}
{{#if job.companyWebsite}}- Company Website: {{job.companyWebsite}} (RESEARCH: Look for company culture, mission, values){{/if}}
{{#if job.jobDescription}}- Job Description (RESEARCH: Look for culture clues, team dynamics, company values):
{{job.jobDescription}}{{/if}}

CANDIDATE EXPERIENCE (includes both professional and personal):
{{experienceData}}

IMPORTANT: The experienceData above includes both:
- Professional experience entries (jobs, projects)
- Personal blurbs/bio sections (life story, interests, values, motivations)

TASK:
1. **Research the company** (if website/description provided):
   - What's their culture like? (startup energy? corporate? creative? mission-driven?)
   - What are their values? (innovation? social impact? work-life balance?)
   - What makes them unique?

2. **Find personal connections**:
   - Look through blurbs for personal stories, interests, or values
   - Cross-reference with company culture/mission
   - Find authentic connections (not forced)

3. **Select 2-3 key points total**:
   - 1-2 personal experiences/values that align with company culture
   - 1-2 professional accomplishments that demonstrate technical fit
   - Make sure each point tells a mini-story

4. **Write in a casual, conversational tone**:
   - Imagine you're writing to a friend who works there
   - Use natural language and contractions
   - Let personality come through
   - Be specific and memorable

5. **Structure**:
   - Opening: Hook them with a personal story or genuine connection to the company
   - Body: Weave together 1-2 personal points + 1-2 professional points
   - Closing: Express genuine enthusiasm + specific question or idea about the role

6. **Formatting**:
   - 3 paragraphs maximum
   - Address to "Hiring Manager" or first name if provided
   - Use {{personalInfo.name}} in signature
   - Skip formal phrases like "Sincerely" - use "Best," "Cheers," or just your name

Generate a compelling, authentic cover letter that shows both professional competence and personal fit with the company culture.

entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Full-time · Remote
entries.title: Fulfil Solutions
entries.body:
- Scaled the platform from stealth to powering three automated grocery stores (DoorDash DashMart, Whole Foods).
 - Integrated partners (Amazon, DoorDash, Uber Eats, Stripe, TaxJar, Twilio, SendGrid, PagerDuty, Slack) to unlock new fulfillment and comms flows. 
 - Architected & delivered APIs and automation for Amazon Fresh/Whole Foods delivery systems; operationalized with dashboards/alerts. 
 - Built async job pipelines (BullMQ / queues) and cache patterns that stabilized workloads under bursty demand. 
 - Stack: Angular, Node.js (TypeScript), MySQL, Redis, MongoDB, BullMQ, Pub/Sub, Kubernetes, GCP, Grafana/Loki, Elastic. 
**Skills:** Google Cloud Platform (GCP) · Firebase · Angular.JS · GitHub · Node.js

## Projects

### Amazon Fresh / Whole Foods
I was on the team engaged on a year-long project to build the cloud infrastructure and API to integrate with Amazon. We worked closely with Amazon's team to translate their business requirements into feasible requirements that would work with our system, which was built with a different architecture in mind. The project was a success, and now Fulfil's robotics are being implemented in whole foods across the US.

### order management web apps
My team was responsible for building and maintaining the end-user facing web (mobile) application and the kiosk application for order pickup.

### Marketplace support
My team was responsible for integrating with marketplaces including Doordash and Uber eats. This meant communicating inventory, order status and lifecycle events, and customer support.
We used Doordash Drive for last mile delivery.

entries.title: OPNA dev
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Oakland, CA · 5 yrs 9 mos
entries.body:
- Delivered custom web apps, integrations, and internal tools for Intuit, McDonald’s, Google and others.
 - Built full-stack solutions with React, Node.js, Python; designed GCP deployments for production scale.
 - Implemented featured GCP products as part of Google’s partner program:
     - Enterprise apps on Dialogflow (natural language pipeline).
     - Game Servers for a large mobile gaming company.
 - Partnered cross-functionally to design user-focused products and streamline ops workflows.

## Clients

### Intuit
Intuit's marketing team often needed widgets implemented into their product quickly and efficiently. These widgets had to use vanilla JS as we were not allowed access to their dependency library, and had to have excellent text coverage.

### Google Partner Program
The reason I got the GCP professional Developer Certificate was to qualify as a contractor in the partner program. When Google had a partner that was interested in a new product they would bring me on to implement said product into the partner's platform. This required me to quickly learn the best practices for the new product and implement it in whatever language and frameworks the partner happened to be using.

#### Dialogflow & JLL
I was brought on to create a massive microservice architecture that sat behind an NLP interface. The app was a simple chat with a bot, but could do everything from schedule corporate meetings to order take out. The most requested feature was managing facilities requests. Namely temperature control.

**Stack**: Dialogflow, App Engine, GCP, StackTrace, GraphQL, Apollo, CircleCI, React, CodeClimate

#### Dialogflow & McDonalds
I was on a team that implemented McDonald's entire menu into a chat application for customer ordering. This allowed for substitutions and order modifications, as well as coupons and special codes.

**Stack**: Dialogflow, Node, Express

#### Game servers
In a multiplayer video game context you cannot simply scale containers up and down to react to load like a normal application. Game servers is a GCP product that allows you to select a set of users for a "match" and assign them to a specific instance. the container is then automatically spun up and down for the duration of the match.

**Stack**: Python, gRPC, Docker

### Bartendro
An open source cocktail mixing machine. We rebuilt the UI and implemented a containerized server that communicated with the hardware. We added observability, remote updates, remote monitoring, and cloud menu management.

**Stack**: Docker, React, Raspberry Pi

entries.body:
- Design, program and maintain interactive multimedia display systems for events and permanent installations
 - Implemented tools for broadcast including many used on the red carpet for awards shows.
 - Built and maintained BSO's (Bright Shiny Onjects) for marketing initiatives.
 - Clients included: Facebook, Instagram, Salesforce, Pinterest, Twitter
 - Python, GLSL, Touch Designer, Javascript

## Instagram Instastop / Twitter Golden Screen
One of the primary pieces I created at Britelite was a touch screen interface that pulled content from a moderated social media stream and allowed celebrities at the event to record responses live on broadcast that would then be pushed to the moderation and marketing team to re-post as contractually allowed.

challenges: live on the air - no mistakes.
calibrating color temperature for the cameras.
the touch screens were IR grids that were sensitive to the flood lights, causing ghost touches.
Super high pressure environment. FB / Instagram / Twitter would pay millions for their 30 second spot so it had to be perfect.

blurbs.name: biography
blurbs.title: Biography
blurbs.content:
As a lifelong type 1 diabetic (diagnosed at 18 months), I’ve always had a distinct perspective on risk and responsibility. Confronting mortality so young meant learning to enjoy life and pursue goals, playing on sports teams, traveling, without compromising my ability to manage my condition. Living with continual frustrations taught me to stay calm where others might panic; I make sound decisions under pressure and handle situations appropriately.

I studied music at UCSC after being awarded the Regents Scholarship (a full ride for grades and test scores). I originally started as a dual major in Physics and Chemistry, but quickly realized that, during a period of growth and experimentation, music was more engaging than mathematics. In the electronic music program, I discovered computers as a creative medium for music, video, and interactivity. That exploration led me to build a Max/MSP program that triggered lighting and video changes based on musical events, using an adaptive listening algorithm informed by music theory. That project launched my tech career.

As I developed the tool further, I adopted TouchDesigner, extending the system with GLSL and Python. I began building installations for large social media companies, bridging the gap between their online following and live events. The goal was to create a feedback loop between celebrities and their followers (moderated by a marketing team). These experiences reinforced my ability to perform under pressure: live broadcasts that depended on my tools reached millions of viewers and allowed no delays. I had to deliver zero-tolerance software with no room for error.

Throughout my career, I’ve enjoyed applying professional skills to artistic endeavors—especially those that build community. I grew up working in my father’s CNC machine shop, and it has never occurred to me that there’s anything I can’t create (which has also led to many valuable learning opportunities). Trying, adapting, and overcoming new challenges has been part of my personality for as long as I can remember. Not knowing exactly how to do something is a powerful motivator; learning is a reward beyond the success of any single project.

Using technology to foster connection is a big part of my life. Professionally, that meant strengthening relationships between a brand and its customers, and later between users and the tools I built. In personal projects, I focused on bringing people together—sometimes by crafting fun, engaging environments, and other times by proposing playful icebreakers and ways to interact that go beyond small talk without being intrusive.

As a creative technologist and community leader, I thrive in social environments where teams work toward a common goal. I handle pressure well and even enjoy it in moderation. Wherever life leads me, I plan to keep living these ideals in both my professional and personal life.

blurbs.title: Closing Notes

blurbs.name: intro
blurbs.title: Overview
blurbs.content:
## Senior Full-Stack & Platform Engineer
I design and ship production systems where product velocity and platform reliability meet. Recent work spans low-latency messaging, partner integrations, and shared tooling that standardizes observability and security across services.

**Primary stack**: TypeScript/React • Node.js • Python • Postgres/MySQL/Redis • Kubernetes • GCP

**Quick links**: [GitHub](https://github.com/Jdubz) • [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/joshwentworth/) • [Email](mailto:contact@joshwentworth.com)

*I build user-facing features on top of solid platforms—measurable reliability, happy developers, faster product cycles.*

blurbs.name: selected-projects
blurbs.title: Selected Projects
blurbs.content:
## Profile website
this website is a full stack application meant to demonstrate some of my skills.
**stack**: React • Gatsby • Theme UI • Nodejs • Express • Firebase • Google Cloud Functions • Firebase Auth • Firestore 
[Source Code](https://github.com/Jdubz/portfolio)

## Audio-Reactive LED Fire-Totem
Real-time mic/IMU pipeline (C++/Arduino) with adaptive gain, serial console, and 16×8 WS2812 flame visualization. Emphasizes DSP, performance under constraints, and param UX.
**Stack**: C++ • Arduino • Rhino Cad • AI electrical advice from ChatGPT
[Source Code](https://github.com/Jdubz/blinky_time)

blurbs.name: skills
blurbs.title: Skills & Technologies
blurbs.content:
- **frontend** - Angular, React, Mobx, Sentry, tailwind, shadcn, bootstrap, themeui, materialui, styled components
- **backend** — nodejs, express, apollo, python, Flask, C++
- **platform** — GCP, Linux, Docker 
- **integrations** — Doordash Marketplce, Doordash Drive, Uber Eats Marketplace, Stripe, Taxjar, Contentful, Twilio, SendGrid, PagerDuty, Slack
- **messaging / queues** — BullMQ, RabbitMQ
- **performance** — Lighthouse
- **reliability** — SLAs, incident response, error budgets  
- **observability** — Sentry, Promethius, Elasctic, Google Stacktrace, PagerDuty
- **security** — redaction/PII, authN/Z patterns, signatures  
- **payments / tax** — Stripe, TaxJar, reconciliation, audits  
- **ux / ab testing** — funnels, flags, experimentation  
- **gcp / kubernetes / redis / postgres / typescript** — technology anchors

job.jobDescriptionText:
Build Technology That Empowers Mental Health Care

You have a unique opportunity to join a mission-driven team dedicated to transforming access to high-quality mental health care. We are a well-funded startup, backed by leading investors like Insight Partners, Optum Ventures, and First Round Capital, and recognized as one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies in Health.


Our platform supports mental health providers in building thriving private practices. By giving them powerful tools to manage and grow their business, we enable them to focus on what they do best: providing exceptional care to their clients. When you join us, you won't just be writing code; you'll be directly removing barriers to mental health care for thousands of people.


What You’ll Do

In this role, you will be a key leader on a scaling team, with a significant impact on our clinical documentation features—a core part of the provider experience.


You will spend 60% of your time working full-stack across our codebase with a primary focus on frontend development.
You will dedicate 10% of your time to planning complex, multi-team projects with stakeholders, guiding execution and ensuring successful delivery.
You will own 10% of your time to the team’s technical execution, helping to set goals and refine prioritization practices.
You will use 10% of your time to mentor and uplift other software engineers.
You will go beyond your immediate team, spending 10% of your time to improve engineering practices across your domain.
How You’ll Do It

You will gain a deep empathy for our providers—understanding their workflows, their challenges, and their needs.
You will design, develop, and implement scalable features using our modern tech stack, including React, TypeScript, Python, Django, and MySQL.
You will build both provider-facing and internal tools that are critical to clinical care.
You will collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and other engineers to conceptualize and build pragmatic solutions to complex problems.
You will ensure everything you build meets our high standards for performance, scalability, and security.
Who You Are

You have 6-10 years of experience as a software engineer with a proven history of working across the stack (with a frontend focus) and building products at scale.
You enjoy the challenge of collaborating on complex projects and guiding them to completion.
You have extensive experience with modern web technologies and frameworks.
You possess a strong understanding of accessibility (a11y) and security compliance.
You have implemented automated testing platforms and are committed to code quality.
You are proficient with Git and modern versioning workflows.
You thrive in a customer-centered development process and love collaborating closely with a cross-functional team.
You have a desire to experiment, learn from outcomes, and use research and data to inform your decisions.


What We Offer You

A Remote-First Culture: Work from anywhere in the U.S.
Comprehensive Health Benefits: Medical, dental, and vision insurance through Aetna and MetLife, with FSA and HSA plans.
Financial Wellness: 401(K) plan and financial perks through Northstar and BenefitHub.
Holistic Support: Monthly stipends for therapy, wellness, co-working spaces, and your home office.
Time Off: Flexible PTO, 12 paid holidays, 1 "Give Back" day, and comprehensive parental leave plans.
And More: Pet discount programs, a one-time home office stipend, and EAP access..

entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Full-time · Remote
entries.title: Fulfil Solutions
entries.body:
- Scaled the platform from stealth to powering three automated grocery stores (DoorDash DashMart, Whole Foods).
 - Integrated partners (Amazon, DoorDash, Uber Eats, Stripe, TaxJar, Twilio, SendGrid, PagerDuty, Slack) to unlock new fulfillment and comms flows. 
 - Architected & delivered APIs and automation for Amazon Fresh/Whole Foods delivery systems; operationalized with dashboards/alerts. 
 - Built async job pipelines (BullMQ / queues) and cache patterns that stabilized workloads under bursty demand. 
 - Stack: Angular, Node.js (TypeScript), MySQL, Redis, MongoDB, BullMQ, Pub/Sub, Kubernetes, GCP, Grafana/Loki, Elastic. 
**Skills:** Google Cloud Platform (GCP) · Firebase · Angular.JS · GitHub · Node.js

## Projects

### Amazon Fresh / Whole Foods
I was on the team engaged on a year-long project to build the cloud infrastructure and API to integrate with Amazon. We worked closely with Amazon's team to translate their business requirements into feasible requirements that would work with our system, which was built with a different architecture in mind. The project was a success, and now Fulfil's robotics are being implemented in whole foods across the US.

### order management web apps
My team was responsible for building and maintaining the end-user facing web (mobile) application and the kiosk application for order pickup.

### Marketplace support
My team was responsible for integrating with marketplaces including Doordash and Uber eats. This meant communicating inventory, order status and lifecycle events, and customer support.
We used Doordash Drive for last mile delivery.

entries.title: Meow Wolf
entries.body:
I worked on multiple web applications, as well as their component library, and integrated with the docker system for fleet management. These applications had a complex pub/sub architecture to view who was using the installation (if logged in) and update their profile based on completing puzzles.

Stack: Docker, React, Styled Components, Bootstrap, MaterialUI, Pub/Sub

entries.title: OPNA dev
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Oakland, CA · 5 yrs 9 mos
entries.body:
- Delivered custom web apps, integrations, and internal tools for Intuit, McDonald’s, Google and others.
 - Built full-stack solutions with React, Node.js, Python; designed GCP deployments for production scale.
 - Implemented featured GCP products as part of Google’s partner program:
     - Enterprise apps on Dialogflow (natural language pipeline).
     - Game Servers for a large mobile gaming company.
 - Partnered cross-functionally to design user-focused products and streamline ops workflows.

## Clients

### Intuit
Intuit's marketing team often needed widgets implemented into their product quickly and efficiently. These widgets had to use vanilla JS as we were not allowed access to their dependency library, and had to have excellent text coverage.

### Google Partner Program
The reason I got the GCP professional Developer Certificate was to qualify as a contractor in the partner program. When Google had a partner that was interested in a new product they would bring me on to implement said product into the partner's platform. This required me to quickly learn the best practices for the new product and implement it in whatever language and frameworks the partner happened to be using.

#### Dialogflow & JLL
I was brought on to create a massive microservice architecture that sat behind an NLP interface. The app was a simple chat with a bot, but could do everything from schedule corporate meetings to order take out. The most requested feature was managing facilities requests. Namely temperature control.

**Stack**: Dialogflow, App Engine, GCP, StackTrace, GraphQL, Apollo, CircleCI, React, CodeClimate

#### Dialogflow & McDonalds
I was on a team that implemented McDonald's entire menu into a chat application for customer ordering. This allowed for substitutions and order modifications, as well as coupons and special codes.

**Stack**: Dialogflow, Node, Express

#### Game servers
In a multiplayer video game context you cannot simply scale containers up and down to react to load like a normal application. Game servers is a GCP product that allows you to select a set of users for a "match" and assign them to a specific instance. the container is then automatically spun up and down for the duration of the match.

**Stack**: Python, gRPC, Docker

### Bartendro
An open source cocktail mixing machine. We rebuilt the UI and implemented a containerized server that communicated with the hardware. We added observability, remote updates, remote monitoring, and cloud menu management.

**Stack**: Docker, React, Raspberry Pi

entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - San Francisco Bay Area · 1 yr 11 mos
entries.body:
- Built applications across enterprise software and embedded systems; worked in JavaScript, Python, and real-time system design.

## Digital Promise
 - Designed and implemented the micro-credential builder for [Digital Promise](https://digitalpromise.org/initiative/micro-credentials/)
     - Used by the NEA, National Geographic, and many other national education programs.

entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - 665 chestnut st, 2nd flr · 2 yrs 8 mos
entries.body:
- Design, program and maintain interactive multimedia display systems for events and permanent installations
 - Implemented tools for broadcast including many used on the red carpet for awards shows.
 - Built and maintained BSO's (Bright Shiny Objects) for marketing initiatives.
 - Clients included: Facebook, Instagram, Salesforce, Pinterest, Twitter
 - Python, GLSL, Touch Designer, Javascript

## Instagram Instastop / Twitter Golden Screen
One of the primary pieces I created at Britelite was a touch screen interface that pulled content from a moderated social media stream and allowed celebrities at the event to record responses live on broadcast that would then be pushed to the moderation and marketing team to re-post as contractually allowed.

challenges: live on the air - no mistakes.
calibrating color temperature for the cameras.
the touch screens were IR grids that were sensitive to the flood lights, causing ghost touches.
Super high pressure environment. FB / Instagram / Twitter would pay millions for their 30 second spot so it had to be perfect.

blurbs.name: biography
blurbs.title: Biography
blurbs.content:
As a lifelong type 1 diabetic (diagnosed at 18 months), I’ve always had a distinct perspective on risk and responsibility. Confronting mortality so young meant learning to enjoy life and pursue goals, playing on sports teams, traveling, without compromising my ability to manage my condition. Living with continual frustrations taught me to stay calm where others might panic; I make sound decisions under pressure and handle situations appropriately.

I studied music at UCSC after being awarded the Regents Scholarship (a full ride for grades and test scores). I originally started as a dual major in Physics and Chemistry, but quickly realized that, during a period of growth and experimentation, music was more engaging than mathematics. In the electronic music program, I discovered computers as a creative medium for music, video, and interactivity. That exploration led me to build a Max/MSP program that triggered lighting and video changes based on musical events, using an adaptive listening algorithm informed by music theory. That project launched my tech career.

As I developed the tool further, I adopted TouchDesigner, extending the system with GLSL and Python. I began building installations for large social media companies, bridging the gap between their online following and live events. The goal was to create a feedback loop between celebrities and their followers (moderated by a marketing team). These experiences reinforced my ability to perform under pressure: live broadcasts that depended on my tools reached millions of viewers and allowed no delays. I had to deliver zero-tolerance software with no room for error.

Throughout my career, I’ve enjoyed applying professional skills to artistic endeavors, especially those that build community. I grew up working in my father’s CNC machine shop, and it has never occurred to me that there’s anything I can’t create (which has also led to many valuable learning opportunities). Trying, adapting, and overcoming new challenges has been part of my personality for as long as I can remember. Not knowing exactly how to do something is a powerful motivator; learning is a reward beyond the success of any single project.

Using technology to foster connection is a big part of my life. Professionally, that meant strengthening relationships between a brand and its customers, and later between users and the tools I built. In personal projects, I focused on bringing people together, sometimes by crafting fun, engaging environments, and other times by proposing playful icebreakers and ways to interact that go beyond small talk without being intrusive.

As a creative technologist and community leader, I thrive in social environments where teams work toward a common goal. I handle pressure well and even enjoy it in moderation. Wherever life leads me, I plan to keep living these ideals in both my professional and personal life.

blurbs.name: closing-notes
blurbs.title: Closing Notes
blurbs.content:
Open to Senior/Staff Full-Stack roles at the app/infra boundary. I love pairing, mentoring, and raising the quality bar.
Contact: contact@joshwentworth.com
 • Portland, OR / Remote

job.jobDescriptionText:
Build Technology That Empowers Mental Health Care

You have a unique opportunity to join a mission-driven team dedicated to transforming access to high-quality mental health care. We are a well-funded startup, backed by leading investors like Insight Partners, Optum Ventures, and First Round Capital, and recognized as one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies in Health.


Our platform supports mental health providers in building thriving private practices. By giving them powerful tools to manage and grow their business, we enable them to focus on what they do best: providing exceptional care to their clients. When you join us, you won't just be writing code; you'll be directly removing barriers to mental health care for thousands of people.


What You’ll Do

In this role, you will be a key leader on a scaling team, with a significant impact on our clinical documentation features—a core part of the provider experience.


You will spend 60% of your time working full-stack across our codebase with a primary focus on frontend development.
You will dedicate 10% of your time to planning complex, multi-team projects with stakeholders, guiding execution and ensuring successful delivery.
You will own 10% of your time to the team’s technical execution, helping to set goals and refine prioritization practices.
You will use 10% of your time to mentor and uplift other software engineers.
You will go beyond your immediate team, spending 10% of your time to improve engineering practices across your domain.
How You’ll Do It

You will gain a deep empathy for our providers—understanding their workflows, their challenges, and their needs.
You will design, develop, and implement scalable features using our modern tech stack, including React, TypeScript, Python, Django, and MySQL.
You will build both provider-facing and internal tools that are critical to clinical care.
You will collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and other engineers to conceptualize and build pragmatic solutions to complex problems.
You will ensure everything you build meets our high standards for performance, scalability, and security.
Who You Are

You have 6-10 years of experience as a software engineer with a proven history of working across the stack (with a frontend focus) and building products at scale.
You enjoy the challenge of collaborating on complex projects and guiding them to completion.
You have extensive experience with modern web technologies and frameworks.
You possess a strong understanding of accessibility (a11y) and security compliance.
You have implemented automated testing platforms and are committed to code quality.
You are proficient with Git and modern versioning workflows.
You thrive in a customer-centered development process and love collaborating closely with a cross-functional team.
You have a desire to experiment, learn from outcomes, and use research and data to inform your decisions.


What We Offer You

A Remote-First Culture: Work from anywhere in the U.S.
Comprehensive Health Benefits: Medical, dental, and vision insurance through Aetna and MetLife, with FSA and HSA plans.
Financial Wellness: 401(K) plan and financial perks through Northstar and BenefitHub.
Holistic Support: Monthly stipends for therapy, wellness, co-working spaces, and your home office.
Time Off: Flexible PTO, 12 paid holidays, 1 "Give Back" day, and comprehensive parental leave plans.
And More: Pet discount programs, a one-time home office stipend, and EAP access..

entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Full-time · Remote
entries.title: Fulfil Solutions
entries.body:
- Scaled the platform from stealth to powering three automated grocery stores (DoorDash DashMart, Whole Foods).
 - Integrated partners (Amazon, DoorDash, Uber Eats, Stripe, TaxJar, Twilio, SendGrid, PagerDuty, Slack) to unlock new fulfillment and comms flows. 
 - Architected & delivered APIs and automation for Amazon Fresh/Whole Foods delivery systems; operationalized with dashboards/alerts. 
 - Built async job pipelines (BullMQ / queues) and cache patterns that stabilized workloads under bursty demand. 
 - Stack: Angular, Node.js (TypeScript), MySQL, Redis, MongoDB, BullMQ, Pub/Sub, Kubernetes, GCP, Grafana/Loki, Elastic. 
**Skills:** Google Cloud Platform (GCP) · Firebase · Angular.JS · GitHub · Node.js

## Projects

### Amazon Fresh / Whole Foods
I was on the team engaged on a year-long project to build the cloud infrastructure and API to integrate with Amazon. We worked closely with Amazon's team to translate their business requirements into feasible requirements that would work with our system, which was built with a different architecture in mind. The project was a success, and now Fulfil's robotics are being implemented in whole foods across the US.

### order management web apps
My team was responsible for building and maintaining the end-user facing web (mobile) application and the kiosk application for order pickup.

### Marketplace support
My team was responsible for integrating with marketplaces including Doordash and Uber eats. This meant communicating inventory, order status and lifecycle events, and customer support.
We used Doordash Drive for last mile delivery.

entries.title: Meow Wolf
entries.body:
I worked on multiple web applications, as well as their component library, and integrated with the docker system for fleet management. These applications had a complex pub/sub architecture to view who was using the installation (if logged in) and update their profile based on completing puzzles.

Stack: Docker, React, Styled Components, Bootstrap, MaterialUI, Pub/Sub

entries.title: OPNA dev
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Oakland, CA · 5 yrs 9 mos
entries.body:
- Delivered custom web apps, integrations, and internal tools for Intuit, McDonald’s, Google and others.
 - Built full-stack solutions with React, Node.js, Python; designed GCP deployments for production scale.
 - Implemented featured GCP products as part of Google’s partner program:
     - Enterprise apps on Dialogflow (natural language pipeline).
     - Game Servers for a large mobile gaming company.
 - Partnered cross-functionally to design user-focused products and streamline ops workflows.

## Clients

### Intuit
Intuit's marketing team often needed widgets implemented into their product quickly and efficiently. These widgets had to use vanilla JS as we were not allowed access to their dependency library, and had to have excellent text coverage.

### Google Partner Program
The reason I got the GCP professional Developer Certificate was to qualify as a contractor in the partner program. When Google had a partner that was interested in a new product they would bring me on to implement said product into the partner's platform. This required me to quickly learn the best practices for the new product and implement it in whatever language and frameworks the partner happened to be using.

#### Dialogflow & JLL
I was brought on to create a massive microservice architecture that sat behind an NLP interface. The app was a simple chat with a bot, but could do everything from schedule corporate meetings to order take out. The most requested feature was managing facilities requests. Namely temperature control.

**Stack**: Dialogflow, App Engine, GCP, StackTrace, GraphQL, Apollo, CircleCI, React, CodeClimate

#### Dialogflow & McDonalds
I was on a team that implemented McDonald's entire menu into a chat application for customer ordering. This allowed for substitutions and order modifications, as well as coupons and special codes.

**Stack**: Dialogflow, Node, Express

#### Game servers
In a multiplayer video game context you cannot simply scale containers up and down to react to load like a normal application. Game servers is a GCP product that allows you to select a set of users for a "match" and assign them to a specific instance. the container is then automatically spun up and down for the duration of the match.

**Stack**: Python, gRPC, Docker

### Bartendro
An open source cocktail mixing machine. We rebuilt the UI and implemented a containerized server that communicated with the hardware. We added observability, remote updates, remote monitoring, and cloud menu management.

**Stack**: Docker, React, Raspberry Pi

blurbs.name: biography
blurbs.title: Biography
blurbs.content:
As a lifelong type 1 diabetic (diagnosed at 18 months), I’ve always had a distinct perspective on risk and responsibility. Confronting mortality so young meant learning to enjoy life and pursue goals, playing on sports teams, traveling, without compromising my ability to manage my condition. Living with continual frustrations taught me to stay calm where others might panic; I make sound decisions under pressure and handle situations appropriately.

I studied music at UCSC after being awarded the Regents Scholarship (a full ride for grades and test scores). I originally started as a dual major in Physics and Chemistry, but quickly realized that, during a period of growth and experimentation, music was more engaging than mathematics. In the electronic music program, I discovered computers as a creative medium for music, video, and interactivity. That exploration led me to build a Max/MSP program that triggered lighting and video changes based on musical events, using an adaptive listening algorithm informed by music theory. That project launched my tech career.

As I developed the tool further, I adopted TouchDesigner, extending the system with GLSL and Python. I began building installations for large social media companies, bridging the gap between their online following and live events. The goal was to create a feedback loop between celebrities and their followers (moderated by a marketing team). These experiences reinforced my ability to perform under pressure: live broadcasts that depended on my tools reached millions of viewers and allowed no delays. I had to deliver zero-tolerance software with no room for error.

Throughout my career, I’ve enjoyed applying professional skills to artistic endeavors, especially those that build community. I grew up working in my father’s CNC machine shop, and it has never occurred to me that there’s anything I can’t create (which has also led to many valuable learning opportunities). Trying, adapting, and overcoming new challenges has been part of my personality for as long as I can remember. Not knowing exactly how to do something is a powerful motivator; learning is a reward beyond the success of any single project.

Using technology to foster connection is a big part of my life. Professionally, that meant strengthening relationships between a brand and its customers, and later between users and the tools I built. In personal projects, I focused on bringing people together, sometimes by crafting fun, engaging environments, and other times by proposing playful icebreakers and ways to interact that go beyond small talk without being intrusive.

As a creative technologist and community leader, I thrive in social environments where teams work toward a common goal. I handle pressure well and even enjoy it in moderation. Wherever life leads me, I plan to keep living these ideals in both my professional and personal life.

job.jobDescriptionText:
Company Overview
Deepgram is the leading voice AI platform for developers building speech-to-text (STT), text-to-speech (TTS) and full speech-to-speech (STS) offerings. 200,000+ developers build with Deepgram’s voice-native foundational models – accessed through APIs or as self-managed software – due to our unmatched accuracy, latency and pricing. Customers include software companies building voice products, co-sell partners working with large enterprises, and enterprises solving internal voice AI use cases. The company ended 2024 cash-flow positive with 400+ enterprise customers, 3.3x annual usage growth across the past 4 years, over 50,000 years of audio processed and over 1 trillion words transcribed. There is no organization in the world that understands voice better than Deepgram.

Company Operating Rhythm
At Deepgram, we expect an AI-first mindset—AI use and comfort aren’t optional, they’re core to how we operate, innovate, and measure performance.

Every team member who works at Deepgram is expected to actively use and experiment with advanced AI tools, and even build your own into your everyday work. We measure how effectively AI is applied to deliver results, and consistent, creative use of the latest AI capabilities is key to success here. Candidates should be comfortable adopting new models and modes quickly, integrating AI into their workflows, and continuously pushing the boundaries of what these technologies can do.

Additionally, we move at the pace of AI. Change is rapid, and you can expect your day-to-day work to evolve just as quickly. This may not be the right role if you’re not excited to experiment, adapt, think on your feet, and learn constantly, or if you’re seeking something highly prescriptive with a traditional 9-to-5.

Opportunity:

We're looking for an expert (Senior/Staff) Full Stack Engineer to build the Internal Developer Platform that powers our product and research teams. You will architect and build the web services, UIs, and APIs that empower our engineers to build, test, and deploy sophisticated AI-powered applications with ease. This role is focused on creating a cohesive, self-service environment that streamlines the entire development lifecycle, from code to production.

What You’ll Do

Design, build, and maintain scalable backend services and APIs for our internal developer platform.

Develop and manage robust data pipelines to support engineering and research workflows.

Build tooling and automation to enhance developer productivity and streamline CI/CD processes.

Collaborate with product and research teams to integrate new AI capabilities into the platform.

Ensure the reliability, performance, and scalability of the platform's backend infrastructure.

You’ll Love This Role If You

Are passionate about building intuitive developer tools and user interfaces.

Enjoy designing and implementing elegant, end-to-end developer workflows.

Love solving challenging problems by building robust backend services and APIs.

Are excited about leveraging AI to enhance developer productivity and platform capabilities.

Want to work at the intersection of software engineering, infrastructure, and AI.

It’s Important To Us That You Have

5+ years of experience in full-stack software development.

Proficiency in both front-end (e.g., React, Vue) and back-end (e.g., Python, Go, Node.js) development.

Demonstrated experience building internal developer platforms or similar developer-centric tooling.

Expertise in leveraging AI APIs or building applications on top of large language models.

Experience with containerization (Docker) and orchestration platforms (Kubernetes).

A strong understanding of CI/CD principles and building automated pipelines.

  

It Would Be Great if You Had 

Experience with Infrastructure-as-Code (e.g., Terraform, Pulumi).

Knowledge of cost optimization strategies for cloud infrastructure.

Experience contributing to open-source developer tools.

blurbs.name: biography
blurbs.title: Biography
blurbs.content:
As a lifelong type 1 diabetic (diagnosed at 18 months), I’ve always had a distinct perspective on risk and responsibility. Confronting mortality so young meant learning to enjoy life and pursue goals, playing on sports teams, traveling, without compromising my ability to manage my condition. Living with continual frustrations taught me to stay calm where others might panic; I make sound decisions under pressure and handle situations appropriately.

I studied music at UCSC after being awarded the Regents Scholarship (a full ride for grades and test scores). I originally started as a dual major in Physics and Chemistry, but quickly realized that, during a period of growth and experimentation, music was more engaging than mathematics. In the electronic music program, I discovered computers as a creative medium for music, video, and interactivity. That exploration led me to build a Max/MSP program that triggered lighting and video changes based on musical events, using an adaptive listening algorithm informed by music theory. That project launched my tech career.

As I developed the tool further, I adopted TouchDesigner, extending the system with GLSL and Python. I began building installations for large social media companies, bridging the gap between their online following and live events. The goal was to create a feedback loop between celebrities and their followers (moderated by a marketing team). These experiences reinforced my ability to perform under pressure: live broadcasts that depended on my tools reached millions of viewers and allowed no delays. I had to deliver zero-tolerance software with no room for error.

Throughout my career, I’ve enjoyed applying professional skills to artistic endeavors, especially those that build community. I grew up working in my father’s CNC machine shop, and it has never occurred to me that there’s anything I can’t create (which has also led to many valuable learning opportunities). Trying, adapting, and overcoming new challenges has been part of my personality for as long as I can remember. Not knowing exactly how to do something is a powerful motivator; learning is a reward beyond the success of any single project.

Using technology to foster connection is a big part of my life. Professionally, that meant strengthening relationships between a brand and its customers, and later between users and the tools I built. In personal projects, I focused on bringing people together, sometimes by crafting fun, engaging environments, and other times by proposing playful icebreakers and ways to interact that go beyond small talk without being intrusive.

As a creative technologist and community leader, I thrive in social environments where teams work toward a common goal. I handle pressure well and even enjoy it in moderation. Wherever life leads me, I plan to keep living these ideals in both my professional and personal life.

job.jobDescriptionText:
Company Overview
Deepgram is the leading voice AI platform for developers building speech-to-text (STT), text-to-speech (TTS) and full speech-to-speech (STS) offerings. 200,000+ developers build with Deepgram’s voice-native foundational models – accessed through APIs or as self-managed software – due to our unmatched accuracy, latency and pricing. Customers include software companies building voice products, co-sell partners working with large enterprises, and enterprises solving internal voice AI use cases. The company ended 2024 cash-flow positive with 400+ enterprise customers, 3.3x annual usage growth across the past 4 years, over 50,000 years of audio processed and over 1 trillion words transcribed. There is no organization in the world that understands voice better than Deepgram.

Company Operating Rhythm
At Deepgram, we expect an AI-first mindset—AI use and comfort aren’t optional, they’re core to how we operate, innovate, and measure performance.

Every team member who works at Deepgram is expected to actively use and experiment with advanced AI tools, and even build your own into your everyday work. We measure how effectively AI is applied to deliver results, and consistent, creative use of the latest AI capabilities is key to success here. Candidates should be comfortable adopting new models and modes quickly, integrating AI into their workflows, and continuously pushing the boundaries of what these technologies can do.

Additionally, we move at the pace of AI. Change is rapid, and you can expect your day-to-day work to evolve just as quickly. This may not be the right role if you’re not excited to experiment, adapt, think on your feet, and learn constantly, or if you’re seeking something highly prescriptive with a traditional 9-to-5.

Opportunity:

We're looking for an expert (Senior/Staff) Full Stack Engineer to build the Internal Developer Platform that powers our product and research teams. You will architect and build the web services, UIs, and APIs that empower our engineers to build, test, and deploy sophisticated AI-powered applications with ease. This role is focused on creating a cohesive, self-service environment that streamlines the entire development lifecycle, from code to production.

What You’ll Do

Design, build, and maintain scalable backend services and APIs for our internal developer platform.

Develop and manage robust data pipelines to support engineering and research workflows.

Build tooling and automation to enhance developer productivity and streamline CI/CD processes.

Collaborate with product and research teams to integrate new AI capabilities into the platform.

Ensure the reliability, performance, and scalability of the platform's backend infrastructure.

You’ll Love This Role If You

Are passionate about building intuitive developer tools and user interfaces.

Enjoy designing and implementing elegant, end-to-end developer workflows.

Love solving challenging problems by building robust backend services and APIs.

Are excited about leveraging AI to enhance developer productivity and platform capabilities.

Want to work at the intersection of software engineering, infrastructure, and AI.

It’s Important To Us That You Have

5+ years of experience in full-stack software development.

Proficiency in both front-end (e.g., React, Vue) and back-end (e.g., Python, Go, Node.js) development.

Demonstrated experience building internal developer platforms or similar developer-centric tooling.

Expertise in leveraging AI APIs or building applications on top of large language models.

Experience with containerization (Docker) and orchestration platforms (Kubernetes).

A strong understanding of CI/CD principles and building automated pipelines.

  

It Would Be Great if You Had 

Experience with Infrastructure-as-Code (e.g., Terraform, Pulumi).

Knowledge of cost optimization strategies for cloud infrastructure.

Experience contributing to open-source developer tools.

entries.title: Fulfil Solutions
entries.body:
- Scaled the platform from stealth to powering three automated grocery stores (DoorDash DashMart, Whole Foods).
 - Integrated partners (Amazon, DoorDash, Uber Eats, Stripe, TaxJar, Twilio, SendGrid, PagerDuty, Slack) to unlock new fulfillment and comms flows. 
 - Architected & delivered APIs and automation for Amazon Fresh/Whole Foods delivery systems; operationalized with dashboards/alerts. 
 - Built async job pipelines (BullMQ / queues) and cache patterns that stabilized workloads under bursty demand. 
 - Stack: Angular, Node.js (TypeScript), MySQL, Redis, MongoDB, BullMQ, Pub/Sub, Kubernetes, GCP, Grafana/Loki, Elastic. 
**Skills:** Google Cloud Platform (GCP) · Firebase · Angular.JS · GitHub · Node.js

## Projects

### Amazon Fresh / Whole Foods
I was on the team engaged on a year-long project to build the cloud infrastructure and API to integrate with Amazon. We worked closely with Amazon's team to translate their business requirements into feasible requirements that would work with our system, which was built with a different architecture in mind. The project was a success, and now Fulfil's robotics are being implemented in whole foods across the US.

### order management web apps
My team was responsible for building and maintaining the end-user facing web (mobile) application and the kiosk application for order pickup.

### Marketplace support
My team was responsible for integrating with marketplaces including Doordash and Uber eats. This meant communicating inventory, order status and lifecycle events, and customer support.
We used Doordash Drive for last mile delivery.

entries.title: Meow Wolf
entries.body:
I worked on multiple web applications, as well as their component library, and integrated with the docker system for fleet management. These applications had a complex pub/sub architecture to view who was using the installation (if logged in) and update their profile based on completing puzzles.

Stack: Docker, React, Styled Components, Bootstrap, MaterialUI, Pub/Sub

entries.title: OPNA dev
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Oakland, CA · 5 yrs 9 mos
entries.body:
- Delivered custom web apps, integrations, and internal tools for Intuit, McDonald’s, Google and others.
 - Built full-stack solutions with React, Node.js, Python; designed GCP deployments for production scale.
 - Implemented featured GCP products as part of Google’s partner program:
     - Enterprise apps on Dialogflow (natural language pipeline).
     - Game Servers for a large mobile gaming company.
 - Partnered cross-functionally to design user-focused products and streamline ops workflows.

## Clients

### Intuit
Intuit's marketing team often needed widgets implemented into their product quickly and efficiently. These widgets had to use vanilla JS as we were not allowed access to their dependency library, and had to have excellent text coverage.

### Google Partner Program
The reason I got the GCP professional Developer Certificate was to qualify as a contractor in the partner program. When Google had a partner that was interested in a new product they would bring me on to implement said product into the partner's platform. This required me to quickly learn the best practices for the new product and implement it in whatever language and frameworks the partner happened to be using.

#### Dialogflow & JLL
I was brought on to create a massive microservice architecture that sat behind an NLP interface. The app was a simple chat with a bot, but could do everything from schedule corporate meetings to order take out. The most requested feature was managing facilities requests. Namely temperature control.

**Stack**: Dialogflow, App Engine, GCP, StackTrace, GraphQL, Apollo, CircleCI, React, CodeClimate

#### Dialogflow & McDonalds
I was on a team that implemented McDonald's entire menu into a chat application for customer ordering. This allowed for substitutions and order modifications, as well as coupons and special codes.

**Stack**: Dialogflow, Node, Express

#### Game servers
In a multiplayer video game context you cannot simply scale containers up and down to react to load like a normal application. Game servers is a GCP product that allows you to select a set of users for a "match" and assign them to a specific instance. the container is then automatically spun up and down for the duration of the match.

**Stack**: Python, gRPC, Docker

### Bartendro
An open source cocktail mixing machine. We rebuilt the UI and implemented a containerized server that communicated with the hardware. We added observability, remote updates, remote monitoring, and cloud menu management.

**Stack**: Docker, React, Raspberry Pi

entries.body:

## Digital Promise

     - Used by the NEA, National Geographic, and many other national education programs.

 - Python, GLSL, Touch Designer, Javascript

## Instagram Instastop / Twitter Golden Screen
One of the primary pieces I created at Britelite was a touch screen interface that pulled content from a moderated social media stream and allowed celebrities at the event to record responses live on broadcast that would then be pushed to the moderation and marketing team to re-post as contractually allowed.

challenges: live on the air - no mistakes.
calibrating color temperature for the cameras.
the touch screens were IR grids that were sensitive to the flood lights, causing ghost touches.
Super high pressure environment. FB / Instagram / Twitter would pay millions for their 30 second spot so it had to be perfect.

blurbs.name: biography
blurbs.title: Biography
blurbs.content:
As a lifelong type 1 diabetic (diagnosed at 18 months), I’ve always had a distinct perspective on risk and responsibility. Confronting mortality so young meant learning to enjoy life and pursue goals, playing on sports teams, traveling, without compromising my ability to manage my condition. Living with continual frustrations taught me to stay calm where others might panic; I make sound decisions under pressure and handle situations appropriately.

I studied music at UCSC after being awarded the Regents Scholarship (a full ride for grades and test scores). I originally started as a dual major in Physics and Chemistry, but quickly realized that, during a period of growth and experimentation, music was more engaging than mathematics. In the electronic music program, I discovered computers as a creative medium for music, video, and interactivity. That exploration led me to build a Max/MSP program that triggered lighting and video changes based on musical events, using an adaptive listening algorithm informed by music theory. That project launched my tech career.

As I developed the tool further, I adopted TouchDesigner, extending the system with GLSL and Python. I began building installations for large social media companies, bridging the gap between their online following and live events. The goal was to create a feedback loop between celebrities and their followers (moderated by a marketing team). These experiences reinforced my ability to perform under pressure: live broadcasts that depended on my tools reached millions of viewers and allowed no delays. I had to deliver zero-tolerance software with no room for error.

Throughout my career, I’ve enjoyed applying professional skills to artistic endeavors, especially those that build community. I grew up working in my father’s CNC machine shop, and it has never occurred to me that there’s anything I can’t create (which has also led to many valuable learning opportunities). Trying, adapting, and overcoming new challenges has been part of my personality for as long as I can remember. Not knowing exactly how to do something is a powerful motivator; learning is a reward beyond the success of any single project.

Using technology to foster connection is a big part of my life. Professionally, that meant strengthening relationships between a brand and its customers, and later between users and the tools I built. In personal projects, I focused on bringing people together, sometimes by crafting fun, engaging environments, and other times by proposing playful icebreakers and ways to interact that go beyond small talk without being intrusive.

As a creative technologist and community leader, I thrive in social environments where teams work toward a common goal. I handle pressure well and even enjoy it in moderation. Wherever life leads me, I plan to keep living these ideals in both my professional and personal life.

job.jobDescriptionText:
Responsibilities:

Perform end to end technical design and code reviews and help make technical design decisions in every phase of product lifecycle
Innovate on new revenue models like subscriptions, commerce or new ad formats, opportunities and new ideas to generate revenue as a media publisher
Create business models to monetize online product offerings , digital advertising technologies and platforms used across all media products, and help media product teams solve critical revenue impacting problems
Improve quality and efficiency from ideation to deployment

A Lot About You:

3+ years of experience and knowledge in frontend programming languages such as Javascript, nodeJS, React, and AngularJS
Understanding of algorithms, data structures, performance optimization techniques, and object-oriented programming
A builder and designer of ad formats
Manage and enable self-serve campaign testing and launch by collaborating with product & engineering teams
Results driven and demonstrated use of iterative development
BS or MS in Computer Science or a related major, or equivalent experience

The material job duties and responsibilities of this role include those listed above as well as adhering to Yahoo policies; exercising sound judgment; working effectively, safely and inclusively with others; exhibiting trustworthiness and meeting expectations; and safeguarding business operations and brand integrity.

At Yahoo, we offer flexible hybrid work options that our employees love! While most roles don’t require regular office attendance, you may occasionally be asked to attend in-person events or team sessions. You’ll always get notice to make arrangements. Your recruiter will let you know if a specific job requires regular attendance at a Yahoo office or facility. If you have any questions about how this applies to the role, just ask the recruiter!

Yahoo is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, and will not be discriminated against based on age, race, gender, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability or any other protected category. Yahoo will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law. Yahoo is dedicated to providing an accessible environment for all candidates during the application process and for employees during their employment. If you need accessibility assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability, please submit a request via the Accommodation Request Form (www.yahooinc.com/careers/contact-us.html) or call +1.866.772.3182. Requests and calls received for non-disability related issues, such as following up on an application, will not receive a response.

We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace strengthens Yahoo and deepens our relationships. When you support everyone to be their best selves, they spark discovery, innovation and creativity. Among other efforts, our 11 employee resource groups (ERGs) enhance a culture of belonging with programs, events and fellowship that help educate, support and create a workplace where all feel welcome.

entries.title: Fulfil Solutions
entries.body:
- Scaled the platform from stealth to powering three automated grocery stores (DoorDash DashMart, Whole Foods).
 - Integrated partners (Amazon, DoorDash, Uber Eats, Stripe, TaxJar, Twilio, SendGrid, PagerDuty, Slack) to unlock new fulfillment and comms flows. 
 - Architected & delivered APIs and automation for Amazon Fresh/Whole Foods delivery systems; operationalized with dashboards/alerts. 
 - Built async job pipelines (BullMQ / queues) and cache patterns that stabilized workloads under bursty demand. 
 - **Skills**: Angular, Node.js (TypeScript), MySQL, Redis, MongoDB, BullMQ, Pub/Sub, Kubernetes, Grafana/Loki, Elastic, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Firebase, GitHub

## Projects

### Amazon Fresh / Whole Foods
I was on the team engaged on a year-long project to build the cloud infrastructure and API to integrate with Amazon. We worked closely with Amazon's team to translate their business requirements into feasible requirements that would work with our system, which was built with a different architecture in mind. The project was a success, and now Fulfil's robotics are being implemented in whole foods across the US.

### Order Management Web Apps
My team was responsible for building and maintaining the end-user facing web (mobile) application and the kiosk application for order pickup.

### Marketplace Support
My team was responsible for integrating with marketplaces including Doordash and Uber eats. This meant communicating inventory, order status and lifecycle events, and customer support.
We used Doordash Drive for last mile delivery.

entries.title: OPNA dev
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Oakland, CA · 5 yrs 9 mos
entries.body:
- Delivered custom web apps, integrations, and internal tools for Intuit, McDonald’s, Google and others.
 - Built full-stack solutions with React, Node.js, Python; designed GCP deployments for production scale.
 - Implemented featured GCP products as part of Google’s partner program:
     - Enterprise apps on Dialogflow (natural language pipeline).
     - Game Servers for a large mobile gaming company.
 - Partnered cross-functionally to design user-focused products and streamline ops workflows.

## Clients

## Intuit
Intuit's marketing team often needed widgets implemented into their product quickly and efficiently. These widgets had to use vanilla JS as we were not allowed access to their dependency library, and had to have excellent text coverage.
**Skills**: Vanilla JS, unit testing

## Google Partner Program
The reason I got the GCP professional Developer Certificate was to qualify as a contractor in the partner program. When Google had a partner that was interested in a new product they would bring me on to implement said product into the partner's platform. This required me to quickly learn the best practices for the new product and implement it in whatever language and frameworks the partner happened to be using.

**Dialogflow & JLL**
I was brought on to create a massive microservice architecture that sat behind an NLP interface. The app was a simple chat with a bot, but could do everything from schedule corporate meetings to order take out. The most requested feature was managing facilities requests. Namely temperature control.
**Skills**: Dialogflow, App Engine, GCP, StackTrace, GraphQL, Apollo, CircleCI, React, CodeClimate

**Dialogflow & McDonalds**
I was on a team that implemented McDonald's entire menu into a chat application for customer ordering. This allowed for substitutions and order modifications, as well as coupons and special codes.
**Skills**: Dialogflow, Node, Express

## Game servers
In a multiplayer video game context you cannot simply scale containers up and down to react to load like a normal application. Game servers is a GCP product that allows you to select a set of users for a "match" and assign them to a specific instance. the container is then automatically spun up and down for the duration of the match.
**Skills**: Python, gRPC, Docker

## Bartendro
An open source cocktail mixing machine. We rebuilt the UI and implemented a containerized server that communicated with the hardware. We added observability, remote updates, remote monitoring, and cloud menu management.
**Skills**: Docker, Django, Python, React, Raspberry Pi

## Driver's Benefits
The client had a massive HIPAA compliant Salesforce instance for case management. Their goal was to help gig workers, specifically drivers, obtain health care through government assistance. We helped them update their workflow to adhere to software best practices, like IAC and unit testing, while maintaining HIPAA compliance.
**Skills**: Salesforce, Java (Apex)

coverLetterContent.openingParagraph: I’ve always been fascinated by how technology can transform everyday experiences, like when I helped build a cloud infrastructure for Amazon Fresh. It was a bit like solving a giant puzzle - translating complex business requirements into seamless tech solutions. This knack for turning challenges into opportunities is why I’m drawn to Yahoo’s mission of innovation and creativity, especially in a role that combines frontend development with new revenue models.
bodyParagraphs: At Fulfil Solutions, I scaled platforms to power automated grocery stores, integrating with big names like Amazon and DoorDash. It was thrilling to see our APIs and automation tools come to life, stabilizing workloads and boosting efficiency. I’ve spent over three years honing my skills in JavaScript, Node.js, and Angular, and I’m eager to bring this experience to Yahoo, where I can contribute to designing ad formats and optimizing performance.

What excites me most about Yahoo is your commitment to a diverse and inclusive workplace. My time at Meow Wolf taught me the value of a creative, inclusive environment - it’s where the best ideas flourish. I’m passionate about building user-focused products that not only meet business goals but also enhance user experiences. I’m looking forward to exploring how I can contribute to Yahoo’s innovative projects and dynamic team.
coverLetterContent.closingParagraph: I’d love to chat about how my background in frontend development and my passion for creative problem-solving could be a great fit for Yahoo. What’s the most exciting project your team is working on right now? Looking forward to the possibility of joining your team!

entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Full-time · Remote
entries.title: Fulfil Solutions
entries.body:
- Scaled the platform from stealth to powering three automated grocery stores (DoorDash DashMart, Whole Foods).
 - Integrated partners (Amazon, DoorDash, Uber Eats, Stripe, TaxJar, Twilio, SendGrid, PagerDuty, Slack) to unlock new fulfillment and comms flows. 
 - Architected & delivered APIs and automation for Amazon Fresh/Whole Foods delivery systems; operationalized with dashboards/alerts. 
 - Built async job pipelines (BullMQ / queues) and cache patterns that stabilized workloads under bursty demand. 
 - **Skills**: Angular, Node.js (TypeScript), MySQL, Redis, MongoDB, BullMQ, Pub/Sub, Kubernetes, Grafana/Loki, Elastic, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Firebase, GitHub

## Projects

### Amazon Fresh / Whole Foods
I was on the team engaged on a year-long project to build the cloud infrastructure and API to integrate with Amazon. We worked closely with Amazon's team to translate their business requirements into feasible requirements that would work with our system, which was built with a different architecture in mind. The project was a success, and now Fulfil's robotics are being implemented in whole foods across the US.

### Order Management Web Apps
My team was responsible for building and maintaining the end-user facing web (mobile) application and the kiosk application for order pickup.

### Marketplace Support
My team was responsible for integrating with marketplaces including Doordash and Uber eats. This meant communicating inventory, order status and lifecycle events, and customer support.
We used Doordash Drive for last mile delivery.
