entries.title: OPNA dev
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Oakland, CA · 5 yrs 9 mos
entries.body:
- Delivered custom web apps, integrations, and internal tools for Intuit, McDonald’s, Google and others.
 - Built full-stack solutions with React, Node.js, Python; designed GCP deployments for production scale.
 - Implemented featured GCP products as part of Google’s partner program:
     - Enterprise apps on Dialogflow (natural language pipeline).
     - Game Servers for a large mobile gaming company.
 - Partnered cross-functionally to design user-focused products and streamline ops workflows.

## Clients

## Intuit
Intuit's marketing team often needed widgets implemented into their product quickly and efficiently. These widgets had to use vanilla JS as we were not allowed access to their dependency library, and had to have excellent text coverage.
**Skills**: Vanilla JS, unit testing

## Google Partner Program
The reason I got the GCP professional Developer Certificate was to qualify as a contractor in the partner program. When Google had a partner that was interested in a new product they would bring me on to implement said product into the partner's platform. This required me to quickly learn the best practices for the new product and implement it in whatever language and frameworks the partner happened to be using.

**Dialogflow & JLL**
I was brought on to create a massive microservice architecture that sat behind an NLP interface. The app was a simple chat with a bot, but could do everything from schedule corporate meetings to order take out. The most requested feature was managing facilities requests. Namely temperature control.
**Skills**: Dialogflow, App Engine, GCP, StackTrace, GraphQL, Apollo, CircleCI, React, CodeClimate

**Dialogflow & McDonalds**
I was on a team that implemented McDonald's entire menu into a chat application for customer ordering. This allowed for substitutions and order modifications, as well as coupons and special codes.
**Skills**: Dialogflow, Node, Express

## Game servers
In a multiplayer video game context you cannot simply scale containers up and down to react to load like a normal application. Game servers is a GCP product that allows you to select a set of users for a "match" and assign them to a specific instance. the container is then automatically spun up and down for the duration of the match.
**Skills**: Python, gRPC, Docker

## Bartendro
An open source cocktail mixing machine. We rebuilt the UI and implemented a containerized server that communicated with the hardware. We added observability, remote updates, remote monitoring, and cloud menu management.
**Skills**: Docker, Django, Python, React, Raspberry Pi

## Driver's Benefits
The client had a massive HIPAA compliant Salesforce instance for case management. Their goal was to help gig workers, specifically drivers, obtain health care through government assistance. We helped them update their workflow to adhere to software best practices, like IAC and unit testing, while maintaining HIPAA compliance.
**Skills**: Salesforce, Java (Apex)

entries.title: BriteLite Immersive
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - 665 chestnut st, 2nd flr · 2 yrs 8 mos
entries.body:
- Designed, programmed, and maintained interactive multimedia display systems for events and permanent installations.
 - Implemented tools for broadcast including many used on the red carpet for awards shows.
 - Built and maintained BSO's (Bright Shiny Objects) for marketing initiatives.
 - Clients included: Facebook, Instagram, Salesforce, Pinterest, Twitter
 - Python, GLSL, Touch Designer, Javascript

## Instagram Instastop / Twitter Golden Screen
One of the primary pieces I created at Britelite was a touch screen interface that pulled content from a moderated social media stream and allowed celebrities at the event to record responses live on broadcast that would then be pushed to the moderation and marketing team to re-post as contractually allowed.

**challenges**
- live on the air - no mistakes.
- calibrating color temperature for the cameras.
- the touch screens were IR grids that were sensitive to the flood lights, causing ghost touches.
- Super high pressure environment. FB / Instagram / Twitter would pay millions for their 30 second spot so it had to be perfect.

blurbs.title: Overview
blurbs.content:
## Senior Full-Stack & Platform Engineer
I design and ship production systems where product velocity and platform reliability meet. Recent work spans low-latency messaging, partner integrations, and shared tooling that standardizes observability and security across services.

**Primary stack**: TypeScript/React • Node.js • Python • Postgres/MySQL/Redis • Kubernetes • GCP

**Quick links**: [GitHub](https://github.com/Jdubz) • [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/joshwentworth/) • [Email](mailto:contact@joshwentworth.com)

*I build user-facing features on top of solid platforms—measurable reliability, happy developers, faster product cycles.*

- **Authentication** - JWT, Oauth2.0

blurbs.name: biography
blurbs.title: Biography
blurbs.content:
As a lifelong type 1 diabetic (diagnosed at 18 months), I’ve always had a distinct perspective on risk and responsibility. Confronting mortality so young meant learning to enjoy life and pursue goals, playing on sports teams, traveling, without compromising my ability to manage my condition. Living with continual frustrations taught me to stay calm where others might panic; I make sound decisions under pressure and handle situations appropriately.

I studied music at UCSC after being awarded the Regents Scholarship (a full ride for grades and test scores). I originally started as a dual major in Physics and Chemistry, but quickly realized that, during a period of growth and experimentation, music was more engaging than mathematics. In the electronic music program, I discovered computers as a creative medium for music, video, and interactivity. That exploration led me to build a Max/MSP program that triggered lighting and video changes based on musical events, using an adaptive listening algorithm informed by music theory. That project launched my tech career.

As I developed the tool further, I adopted TouchDesigner, extending the system with GLSL and Python. I began building installations for large social media companies, bridging the gap between their online following and live events. The goal was to create a feedback loop between celebrities and their followers (moderated by a marketing team). These experiences reinforced my ability to perform under pressure: live broadcasts that depended on my tools reached millions of viewers and allowed no delays. I had to deliver zero-tolerance software with no room for error.

Throughout my career, I’ve enjoyed applying professional skills to artistic endeavors, especially those that build community. I grew up working in my father’s CNC machine shop, and it has never occurred to me that there’s anything I can’t create (which has also led to many valuable learning opportunities). Trying, adapting, and overcoming new challenges has been part of my personality for as long as I can remember. Not knowing exactly how to do something is a powerful motivator; learning is a reward beyond the success of any single project.

Using technology to foster connection is a big part of my life. Professionally, that meant strengthening relationships between a brand and its customers, and later between users and the tools I built. In personal projects, I focused on bringing people together, sometimes by crafting fun, engaging environments, and other times by proposing playful icebreakers and ways to interact that go beyond small talk without being intrusive.

As a creative technologist and community leader, I thrive in social environments where teams work toward a common goal. I handle pressure well and even enjoy it in moderation. Wherever life leads me, I plan to keep living these ideals in both my professional and personal life.

blurbs.name: closing-notes
blurbs.title: Closing Notes
blurbs.content:
Open to Senior/Staff Full-Stack roles at the app/infra boundary. I love pairing, mentoring, and raising the quality bar.
Contact: contact@joshwentworth.com
 • Portland, OR / Remote

blurbs.name: biography
blurbs.title: Biography
blurbs.content:
As a lifelong type 1 diabetic (diagnosed at 18 months), I’ve always had a distinct perspective on risk and responsibility. Confronting mortality so young meant learning to enjoy life and pursue goals, playing on sports teams, traveling, without compromising my ability to manage my condition. Living with continual frustrations taught me to stay calm where others might panic; I make sound decisions under pressure and handle situations appropriately.

I studied music at UCSC after being awarded the Regents Scholarship (a full ride for grades and test scores). I originally started as a dual major in Physics and Chemistry, but quickly realized that, during a period of growth and experimentation, music was more engaging than mathematics. In the electronic music program, I discovered computers as a creative medium for music, video, and interactivity. That exploration led me to build a Max/MSP program that triggered lighting and video changes based on musical events, using an adaptive listening algorithm informed by music theory. That project launched my tech career.

As I developed the tool further, I adopted TouchDesigner, extending the system with GLSL and Python. I began building installations for large social media companies, bridging the gap between their online following and live events. The goal was to create a feedback loop between celebrities and their followers (moderated by a marketing team). These experiences reinforced my ability to perform under pressure: live broadcasts that depended on my tools reached millions of viewers and allowed no delays. I had to deliver zero-tolerance software with no room for error.

Throughout my career, I’ve enjoyed applying professional skills to artistic endeavors, especially those that build community. I grew up working in my father’s CNC machine shop, and it has never occurred to me that there’s anything I can’t create (which has also led to many valuable learning opportunities). Trying, adapting, and overcoming new challenges has been part of my personality for as long as I can remember. Not knowing exactly how to do something is a powerful motivator; learning is a reward beyond the success of any single project.

Using technology to foster connection is a big part of my life. Professionally, that meant strengthening relationships between a brand and its customers, and later between users and the tools I built. In personal projects, I focused on bringing people together, sometimes by crafting fun, engaging environments, and other times by proposing playful icebreakers and ways to interact that go beyond small talk without being intrusive.

As a creative technologist and community leader, I thrive in social environments where teams work toward a common goal. I handle pressure well and even enjoy it in moderation. Wherever life leads me, I plan to keep living these ideals in both my professional and personal life.

coverLetterContent.openingParagraph: When I first heard about Affirm's mission to reinvent credit and make it more honest and friendly, it struck a chord with me. Growing up, I watched my parents struggle with hidden fees and confusing interest rates, so the idea of making financial services transparent and accessible is something I deeply resonate with. Plus, the chance to work on consumer-facing applications that genuinely help people aligns perfectly with my passion for creating impactful tech solutions.
bodyParagraphs: At Fulfil Solutions, I had the opportunity to scale our platform from stealth mode to powering automated grocery stores for big names like DoorDash and Whole Foods. It was a wild ride, integrating partners like Amazon and Uber Eats to streamline fulfillment processes. I loved the challenge of architecting APIs and automation that made complex systems work seamlessly together. This experience honed my skills in building robust, scalable solutions - exactly what Affirm is looking for in a Senior Software Engineer.

Beyond the technical side, I genuinely enjoy mentoring and collaborating with a team. At OPNA dev, I co-founded and led projects that required cross-functional teamwork with clients like Google and McDonald's. We designed user-focused products and streamlined operations, which taught me the importance of listening to diverse perspectives and advocating for innovative ideas. I’m excited about the opportunity to bring this collaborative spirit to Affirm, especially in a role that values mentorship and team growth.
coverLetterContent.closingParagraph: I'm thrilled about the possibility of contributing to Affirm's mission and culture. I'd love to chat about how my experience with scalable systems and team collaboration can support your goals. Is there a time next week that works for a conversation? Looking forward to it!

job.jobDescriptionText:
Hi there!
Zapier’s Workflow Zone is responsible for the core engine that powers our automation platform. As more teams and organizations depend on Zapier to automate critical workflows, we’re investing in scaling the capabilities, reliability, and intelligence of our core product experience.

We’re hiring Frontend Engineers to join several high-impact teams in the Workflow Zone. If you’re passionate about building robust systems, enabling advanced user workflows, and shaping the future of automation, we’d love to hear from you.

The Workflow Zone is where Zapier’s automation magic happens. This zone owns the product experience and execution engine behind creating, running, and debugging workflows (Zaps). We’re focused on building powerful, flexible tools that help individuals and teams automate their work with speed and confidence.

As automation use cases grow more complex—especially for Enterprise users—we’re evolving the platform to support more sophisticated logic, scalable execution, and AI-native experiences. This means:

Building intuitive and resilient workflow authoring experiences

Expanding execution capabilities and logic primitives

Introducing AI-powered tools for creation and troubleshooting

Improving reliability, observability, and control across the system

We’re currently hiring for several teams across the zone, including

Editor Creation

Troubleshooting

Functions

The Editor Creation team is reinventing how users build automations—laying the groundwork for a faster, smarter, and more intuitive workflow authoring experience. Rather than iterating on legacy patterns, this team is redesigning the editor's foundations to support new paradigms like AI-assisted creation and more advanced configuration options.

In this role, you’ll:

Build intuitive, responsive, and performant frontend interfaces that power the Zap creation experience

Partner with Product and Design to simplify complex workflows into accessible UI patterns

Contribute to foundational UI architecture that enables AI-driven and team-specific UX extensibility

Help evolve Zapier’s editor with a strong emphasis on performance, flexibility, and scalability

The Troubleshooting team ensures automations run smoothly—and when they don’t, users have the tools to understand why. This team is focused on preventing, detecting, and resolving workflow errors with clarity and speed.

In this role, you’ll:

Create clear, actionable UI surfaces to help users detect, debug, and resolve Zap errors

Build reusable components and data visualizations that support transparency and insight into automation behavior

Collaborate closely with Support and Product to translate user pain points into effective frontend experiences

Improve observability of automation runs through the user interface

The Functions team is building Zapier’s code-first automation experience — designed for developers who want maximum flexibility when building workflows. With support for coding, testing, secrets, and deployment in one place, Functions brings the power of automation to users who want to work directly in code.

This team is also exploring the future of code-based building at Zapier — unifying the best parts of our code-driven products into a more seamless experience. If you’re excited about developer platforms, scalable infrastructure, and building tools that help users automate complex business processes with code, this is the team for you.

If you enjoy solving messy problems, closing feedback loops, and turning complexity into clarity for users, this is a team where you’ll thrive.

Our Commitment to Applicants

Culture and Values at Zapier

Zapier Guide to Remote Work

Zapier Code of Conduct

Diversity and Inclusivity at Zapier

High Visibility, High Impact
If you thrive on building complex systems that are easy to use and hard to break, this zone is for you:

Work on foundational systems used by millions

Help users build smarter, more powerful automations

Contribute to new AI-native experiences

Collaborate with cross-functional teams across Product, Design, and Support

Join a high-ownership environment with clear user impact and fast iteration

About You
We’re looking for experienced engineers who bring:

Deep experience in React and TypeScript, including performance optimization, architecture, and advanced state management

For Full Stack roles: Advanced experience with Python/Django (and ideally frameworks like Next.js); you’re confident working across the stack and delivering scalable services

Experience building and scaling design systems or reusable frontend platforms

Comfort architecting frontend systems that are secure, accessible, and maintainable at scale. Familiarity operating those systems, in production, for millions of users.

A track record of collaborating closely with Product, Design, and cross-functional engineers to shape UX direction

You help grow your teammates by providing feedback, pairing on complex problems, and contributing to a culture of continuous learning

You navigate ambiguity with confidence, ask sharp questions, and help teams align on outcomes

You’ve used AI tooling for work or personal use. You explore new tools, workflows, and ideas to make things more efficient, and are eager to deepen your understanding of AI and use it regularly

How We Work
Zapier is a 100% remote team, and has been since day one. We value asynchronous communication, transparent collaboration, and work-life harmony. We believe in building systems that scale—both in code and in culture.

If you’re passionate about shaping the future of AI-driven automation, and want to work at a company that cares deeply about its people and its product, we’d love to hear from you.

entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Full-time · Remote
entries.title: Fulfil Solutions
entries.body:
- Scaled the platform from stealth to powering three automated grocery stores (DoorDash DashMart, Whole Foods).
 - Integrated partners (Amazon, DoorDash, Uber Eats, Stripe, TaxJar, Twilio, SendGrid, PagerDuty, Slack) to unlock new fulfillment and comms flows. 
 - Architected & delivered APIs and automation for Amazon Fresh/Whole Foods delivery systems; operationalized with dashboards/alerts. 
 - Built async job pipelines (BullMQ / queues) and cache patterns that stabilized workloads under bursty demand. 
 - **Skills**: Angular, Node.js (TypeScript), MySQL, Redis, MongoDB, BullMQ, Pub/Sub, Kubernetes, Grafana/Loki, Elastic, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Firebase, GitHub

## Projects

### Amazon Fresh / Whole Foods
I was on the team engaged on a year-long project to build the cloud infrastructure and API to integrate with Amazon. We worked closely with Amazon's team to translate their business requirements into feasible requirements that would work with our system, which was built with a different architecture in mind. The project was a success, and now Fulfil's robotics are being implemented in whole foods across the US.

### Order Management Web Apps
My team was responsible for building and maintaining the end-user facing web (mobile) application and the kiosk application for order pickup.

### Marketplace Support
My team was responsible for integrating with marketplaces including Doordash and Uber eats. This meant communicating inventory, order status and lifecycle events, and customer support.
We used Doordash Drive for last mile delivery.

entries.title: OPNA dev
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Oakland, CA · 5 yrs 9 mos
entries.body:
- Delivered custom web apps, integrations, and internal tools for Intuit, McDonald’s, Google and others.
 - Built full-stack solutions with React, Node.js, Python; designed GCP deployments for production scale.
 - Implemented featured GCP products as part of Google’s partner program:
     - Enterprise apps on Dialogflow (natural language pipeline).
     - Game Servers for a large mobile gaming company.
 - Partnered cross-functionally to design user-focused products and streamline ops workflows.

## Clients

## Intuit
Intuit's marketing team often needed widgets implemented into their product quickly and efficiently. These widgets had to use vanilla JS as we were not allowed access to their dependency library, and had to have excellent text coverage.
**Skills**: Vanilla JS, unit testing

## Google Partner Program
The reason I got the GCP professional Developer Certificate was to qualify as a contractor in the partner program. When Google had a partner that was interested in a new product they would bring me on to implement said product into the partner's platform. This required me to quickly learn the best practices for the new product and implement it in whatever language and frameworks the partner happened to be using.

**Dialogflow & JLL**
I was brought on to create a massive microservice architecture that sat behind an NLP interface. The app was a simple chat with a bot, but could do everything from schedule corporate meetings to order take out. The most requested feature was managing facilities requests. Namely temperature control.
**Skills**: Dialogflow, App Engine, GCP, StackTrace, GraphQL, Apollo, CircleCI, React, CodeClimate

**Dialogflow & McDonalds**
I was on a team that implemented McDonald's entire menu into a chat application for customer ordering. This allowed for substitutions and order modifications, as well as coupons and special codes.
**Skills**: Dialogflow, Node, Express

## Game servers
In a multiplayer video game context you cannot simply scale containers up and down to react to load like a normal application. Game servers is a GCP product that allows you to select a set of users for a "match" and assign them to a specific instance. the container is then automatically spun up and down for the duration of the match.
**Skills**: Python, gRPC, Docker

## Bartendro
An open source cocktail mixing machine. We rebuilt the UI and implemented a containerized server that communicated with the hardware. We added observability, remote updates, remote monitoring, and cloud menu management.
**Skills**: Docker, Django, Python, React, Raspberry Pi

## Driver's Benefits
The client had a massive HIPAA compliant Salesforce instance for case management. Their goal was to help gig workers, specifically drivers, obtain health care through government assistance. We helped them update their workflow to adhere to software best practices, like IAC and unit testing, while maintaining HIPAA compliance.
**Skills**: Salesforce, Java (Apex)

blurbs.name: biography
blurbs.title: Biography
blurbs.content:
As a lifelong type 1 diabetic (diagnosed at 18 months), I’ve always had a distinct perspective on risk and responsibility. Confronting mortality so young meant learning to enjoy life and pursue goals, playing on sports teams, traveling, without compromising my ability to manage my condition. Living with continual frustrations taught me to stay calm where others might panic; I make sound decisions under pressure and handle situations appropriately.

I studied music at UCSC after being awarded the Regents Scholarship (a full ride for grades and test scores). I originally started as a dual major in Physics and Chemistry, but quickly realized that, during a period of growth and experimentation, music was more engaging than mathematics. In the electronic music program, I discovered computers as a creative medium for music, video, and interactivity. That exploration led me to build a Max/MSP program that triggered lighting and video changes based on musical events, using an adaptive listening algorithm informed by music theory. That project launched my tech career.

As I developed the tool further, I adopted TouchDesigner, extending the system with GLSL and Python. I began building installations for large social media companies, bridging the gap between their online following and live events. The goal was to create a feedback loop between celebrities and their followers (moderated by a marketing team). These experiences reinforced my ability to perform under pressure: live broadcasts that depended on my tools reached millions of viewers and allowed no delays. I had to deliver zero-tolerance software with no room for error.

Throughout my career, I’ve enjoyed applying professional skills to artistic endeavors, especially those that build community. I grew up working in my father’s CNC machine shop, and it has never occurred to me that there’s anything I can’t create (which has also led to many valuable learning opportunities). Trying, adapting, and overcoming new challenges has been part of my personality for as long as I can remember. Not knowing exactly how to do something is a powerful motivator; learning is a reward beyond the success of any single project.

Using technology to foster connection is a big part of my life. Professionally, that meant strengthening relationships between a brand and its customers, and later between users and the tools I built. In personal projects, I focused on bringing people together, sometimes by crafting fun, engaging environments, and other times by proposing playful icebreakers and ways to interact that go beyond small talk without being intrusive.

As a creative technologist and community leader, I thrive in social environments where teams work toward a common goal. I handle pressure well and even enjoy it in moderation. Wherever life leads me, I plan to keep living these ideals in both my professional and personal life.

coverLetterContent.openingParagraph: I’ve always been fascinated by the magic of automation, ever since I built a cocktail mixing machine that could whip up a drink with just a few taps on a screen. That project taught me the power of seamless integration and user-friendly interfaces, something I see reflected in Zapier’s mission to make automation accessible and intuitive for everyone. I’m thrilled at the idea of contributing to a team that’s redefining how people interact with technology.
bodyParagraphs: At Fulfil Solutions, I scaled platforms to support automated grocery stores, integrating with giants like Amazon and DoorDash. This experience honed my skills in building robust systems that handle complex workflows, much like the challenges Zapier tackles in the Workflow Zone. I’ve architected APIs and async job pipelines that stabilized workloads under high demand, ensuring reliability and performance - key aspects of Zapier’s mission to enhance user confidence in automation.

Beyond the technical side, I’ve always valued collaboration and learning. Whether it was working with Amazon’s team to align on system requirements or partnering with cross-functional teams at OPNA dev to design user-focused products, I thrive in environments where diverse ideas come together to create innovative solutions. I’m particularly drawn to Zapier’s commitment to remote work and asynchronous communication, which aligns perfectly with my belief in flexible, balanced work environments.
coverLetterContent.closingParagraph: I’m genuinely excited about the opportunity to join Zapier and contribute to shaping the future of AI-driven automation. I’d love to explore how my experience with scalable systems and user-centric design can support your mission. How does Zapier envision the next evolution of its automation platform, especially with AI in the mix? Looking forward to the possibility of discussing this further!

My experience in building scalable architectures and seamless integrations aligns well with the needs of your team.
bodyParagraphs: At Fulfil Solutions, I played a pivotal role in scaling our platform from stealth to powering automated grocery stores for major partners like DoorDash and Whole Foods. I architected and delivered APIs and automation systems that integrated with Amazon Fresh, enabling efficient delivery operations. This experience honed my skills in creating robust, scalable solutions that can handle high demand, a crucial aspect for any ecosystem-focused role.

Additionally, as a Co-Founder and Lead Engineer at OPNA dev, I delivered full-stack solutions for clients like Intuit and Google, where I implemented complex integrations and custom web applications. My work with Google’s partner program, particularly on projects involving Dialogflow and GCP, required rapid adaptation to new technologies and frameworks, a skill that I believe is essential for driving innovation at Calendly.

Calendly's commitment to enhancing productivity through seamless scheduling solutions resonates with my passion for creating impactful software. I am particularly drawn to the challenge of expanding Calendly's ecosystem, leveraging my expertise in Node.js, Angular, and cloud platforms to deliver integrations that enhance user experience and operational efficiency.
coverLetter.closingParagraph: I am eager to bring my technical expertise and collaborative spirit to Calendly, contributing to the development of cutting-edge solutions that empower users worldwide. Built async job pipelines and cache patterns to stabilize workloads.
Integrated partners to unlock new fulfillment and communication flows.
Delivered custom web apps and integrations for clients like Intuit and Google.
Built full-stack solutions with React, Node.js, and Python.
Implemented GCP products as part of Google's partner program.
Designed user-focused products and streamlined operational workflows.
Developed web applications and component library with complex pub/sub architecture.
Integrated with Docker for fleet management.
Built applications across enterprise software and embedded systems.
Designed and implemented micro-credential builder for Digital Promise.
Designed and maintained interactive multimedia display systems for events.
Implemented tools for broadcast used on the red carpet for awards shows.

coverLetter.openingParagraph: I’ve always been fascinated by the magic of automation, ever since I built a cocktail mixing machine that could whip up a drink with just a few taps on a screen. That project taught me the power of seamless integration and user-friendly interfaces, something I see reflected in Zapier’s mission to make automation accessible and intuitive for everyone. I’m thrilled at the idea of contributing to a team that’s redefining how people interact with technology.
bodyParagraphs: At Fulfil Solutions, I scaled platforms to support automated grocery stores, integrating with giants like Amazon and DoorDash. This experience honed my skills in building robust systems that handle complex workflows, much like the challenges Zapier tackles in the Workflow Zone. I’ve architected APIs and async job pipelines that stabilized workloads under high demand, ensuring reliability and performance - key aspects of Zapier’s mission to enhance user confidence in automation.

Beyond the technical side, I’ve always valued collaboration and learning. Whether it was working with Amazon’s team to align on system requirements or partnering with cross-functional teams at OPNA dev to design user-focused products, I thrive in environments where diverse ideas come together to create innovative solutions. I’m particularly drawn to Zapier’s commitment to remote work and asynchronous communication, which aligns perfectly with my belief in flexible, balanced work environments.
coverLetter.closingParagraph: I’m genuinely excited about the opportunity to join Zapier and contribute to shaping the future of AI-driven automation. I’d love to explore how my experience with scalable systems and user-centric design can support your mission. How does Zapier envision the next evolution of its automation platform, especially with AI in the mix? Looking forward to the possibility of discussing this further!
